Hi,

I recently recovered my Lenovo laptop and when I sign in my Mozilla account again, nothing happens - no bookmarks, passwords, history etc. are imported. I'm not sure if it's important to mention, but I had to recover my password, in order to sign in after the recovery of my laptop.

When I look at the history of my account, it looks as if it starts on the day I recovered my laptop. I am, however, pretty sure that I use the right sign-in e-mail address.

Is there any way I (or someone from the Mozilla support?) could search with my IP address or the name of my device to find out in which account any history appears prior to the day of my recovery?

Any help would be very much appreciated as I have lost a very big amount of data...

Thank you in advance!

Best, Paris

title: Cloudflare login widgets to "verify you're a human" no longer function
content:
In the last few days, the common Cloudflare widget required to login to many web sites has abruptly stopped functioning in my browser. I'm trying to diagnose what's caused it. I'd appreciate any suggestions or advice.

I noticed the issue on nexusmods.com, but I've confirmed it's a universal problem on ANY site that uses Cloudflare protection. I've continued to use Nexus as my test case.

Observed behavior: 1) The Cloudflare widget loads 2) It displays a checkbox noted, "verify you are human." 3) I click the checkbox. 4) It immediately begins "thinking" (spinny circle and "verifying...") for about nine seconds. There is an "error" message that appears during this, but no details are offered (see screenshot) 5) The widget reloads. 6) Go to step 2

This is an infinite loop.

Fixes attempted: - Disabling all extensions (uBlock, NoScript, Privacy Badger, Decentraleyes) - Clearing cache - Updating to the most recent FF build - Accessing in a private window - Changing DNS settings from Cloudflare to NextDNS - Disabling DNS over HTTPS altogether - Disabling HTTPS-only mode

title: Update issues from 128.7 ESR to 135
content:
I just migrated from an older Mac to a newer one running Mac OS 15 (Sequoia) and none of my bookmarks, autofill info, passwords, cookies and browsing history etc migrated to the new version (135) of firefox that I downloaded. When I check the updates section of 128.7, it says it's up to date, but I know you can run 135 on Sequoia, so that's why I downloaded 135. When I looked at the profile folder in 135, which is existing separately on the Mac from 128.7, I noticed that it was pointed at the folder with release in its name that was inside the profile folder. In 128.7 it's pointed at the other folder with default in the name (the profile folder only seems to contain two folders). How do I get all of my old info to migrate to 135? Or how do I get 135 to point at the proper folder inside of the Profile folder?

Thanks
